commit message:
Added new feature: changing the displayed name of an exercise.

Not possible at the moment: saving this change.

Added saving of customName of FitnessExercises.

Could not test this feature(Tablet is empty :-( ).
Changed error message when there are no exercises in the database.
Added icon_edit.

Added 'restet to default' button to the dialog for changing custom name.

Saving changes does not work.
Bugfix: saving the customName should work now.

Removed 'success' message when loading plan was successful.

A message will only be shown, when any problem occurs.

Update README.md

Added link to f-droid.org and QR codes.

Replaced an AssertionError with Log.e()

So the app will not crash anymore when this error occurs.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:chaosbastler/opentraining

Added support for exercise name I18N.

Besides the standard name you can now provide translations
Example: <Locale language='en' name='english name'/>
The standard name now should also contain information about the language.
Example: <ExerciseType language='de' name='Arnold Presse'>

If there is no language information for an exercise this will be logged.
Same if there is no translation to the language the user needs.
Added Toast message 'default_language_not_german'
Logging improvements in class ExerciseTypeXMLParser.
Formatted ExerciseType.java.
Added warning if an exercise does already exists and should be parsed.

Bugfix of compareTo() of ExerciseType:now localized names will be compared.

Also changed localization process: this will now only happen once.
If the user changes language while OpenTraining is running, changing languge might be ignored.
Update of exercises: added translation to english.

Added class for managing licenses.

Possible usage: link to license, author attribution, list of all authors ...
Added comments to class ExerciseType.

Bugfix: a plan will now show the localized name or (if availabe) the custom name.

Before the unlocalized name was displayed.

Preparing release v0.2.3.

All exercises were translated to english.
Users can also change the name of an exercise (e.g. if it is to long).
